newsitem.title: FRANCE: French shares seen higher after Wall St record.
newsitem.headline: French shares seen higher after Wall St record.

text.p: French shares were expected to open higher, after posting a 1.06 percent gain on Friday, on the back of fresh records on Wall Street following the release of U.S. monthly jobs data.
Dealers said that the CAC-40 index could rise to resistance at 2,725 while the June future contract would see resistance at 2,735.
The dollar was holding above a six-month low against the yen in Japan and started weaker in Europe.
Investor focus will be on Luxembourg where finance minister Dominique Strauss-Kahn will unveil France's stance on the stability pact to European Union partners.
On Friday, shares finished higher for the sixth straight trading day with the blue-chip CAC-40 index closing near its intrasession high, up 1.06 percent or 28.40 points at 2,719.25.
The CAC-40 index has risen 194 points since last Sunday's parliamentary election vaulted the Socialists into power in an alliance with the Communist Party and Greens.
